text.section: This subtitle does not prohibit summary punishment by higher-ranking correctional officers as designated by the managing official.

section.section:
Summary punishment may be imposed for minor violations of correctional facility rules and regulations if:
the facts that constitute the minor violation are not in dispute;
the correctional officer waives the hearing provided under this subtitle; and
the correctional officer accepts the punishment imposed by the highest-ranking correctional officer, or individual acting in that capacity, of the unit to which the correctional officer is attached.
Summary punishment imposed under this subsection may not exceed suspension of 3 days without pay or a fine of $150.

If a correctional officer is offered summary punishment in accordance with subsection (b) of this section and refuses:
the managing official may convene a hearing board of one or more members; and
the hearing board has only the authority to recommend the sanctions provided in this section for summary punishment.

If a single member hearing board is convened:
the member need not be of the same rank as the correctional officer; but
all other provisions of this subtitle apply.
